'''April 2010''' â On April 16, 2010, Continental resumed merger talks with United Airlines after deciding not to merge in 2008.
'''April 2010''' â On April 16, 2010, Continental resumed merger talks with United Airlines after deciding not to merge in 2008.
â
[[File:United Airlines 2010 logo.svg|thumb|United Continental Holdings logo]]
 
'''May 2010''' â On May 2, 2010, the board of directors of both Continental and [[UAL Corporation]]'s United Airlines reached an agreement to combine operations to create the world's largest airline. The combined carrier will take the United Airlines name but will use Continental's logo and livery. The carrier will be based in Chicago and Continental CEO Jeff Smisek will be CEO of the combined airline.<ref>{{Cite news|author=AP |url=http://www.nypost.com/p/news/business/continental_united_airlines_to_combine_cbgXCve0mExFQ1ROzIq7tJ?CMP=OTC-rss&FEEDNAME= |title=Continental, United airlines to combine |work=New York Post |accessdate=May 4, 2010|date=May 2, 2010}}</ref> The merger is contingent upon shareholder and regulatory approval.
'''May 2010''' â On May 2, 2010, the board of directors of both Continental and [[UAL Corporation]]'s United Airlines reached an agreement to combine operations to create the world's largest airline. The combined carrier will take the United Airlines name but will use Continental's logo and livery. The carrier will be based in Chicago and Continental CEO Jeff Smisek will be CEO of the combined airline.<ref>{{Cite news|author=AP |url=http://www.nypost.com/p/news/business/continental_united_airlines_to_combine_cbgXCve0mExFQ1ROzIq7tJ?CMP=OTC-rss&FEEDNAME= |title=Continental, United airlines to combine |work=New York Post |accessdate=May 4, 2010|date=May 2, 2010}}</ref> The merger is contingent upon shareholder and regulatory approval.
